content: slip_stitch to join round 12 single_crochet in same st as slip_stitch and in each double_crochet around slip_stitch to join round 13 chain 2 double_crochet in next 2 single_crochet * skip next 2 scs 5 double_crochet in next single_crochet 5 double_crochet group skip next 2 scs double_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 2-double_crochet group repeat from * across ending with 5 double_crochet group skip last 2 single_crochet and slip_stitch into top of beginning chain round 14 chain 3 * 5 double_crochet in space between first 2 double_crochet double_crochet in space between second and third double_crochet of next 5-double_crochet group and in next space between third and fourth double_crochet repeat from * across slip_stitch to join rnds 15- 37 repeat rnds 13 and 14 note the top edge will be kind of wavy so round 38 will use single_crochet and half_double_crochet to even out the top round 38 chain 1 * 2 half_double_crochet in each double_crochet of 2-double_crochet group half_double_crochet in first stich of 5-double_crochet group single_crochet in next 3 st of 5-double_crochet group half_double_crochet in last st of 5-double_crochet group repeat from * across adjusting half_double_crochet or single_crochet as you see need slip_stitch to join round 39 chain 2 double_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to join round 40 chain 1 single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to join rnds 41-42 repeat rnds 39 and 40 slip_stitch to fasten_off at end of round 42 straps make 2 hook size e or f chain 8 leaving a long tail to attach to bag row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each of remaining 6 single_crochet turn row 2 126 chain 1 single_crochet in each of 7 st do not fasten_off single_crochet in each stitch around outsides of strap making single_crochet 1 chain single_crochet in each corner fasten_off leaving long tail to attach to bag position straps 3-1/2 from outside edge of bag attach using tails i sewed with regular sewing thread first and then used tails to finish © october 12 2008
